column1: #Text=General Assembly elects Ban Ki-moon as next UN chief
#Text=South Korean Ban Ki-moon , 68 , has been endorsed unanimously by the general assembly to succeed Kofi Annan as the secretary-general of the United Nations , on October 13 .
#Text=He will take the position of Secretary General on January 1 .
#Text=When asked by assembly president Sheikha Haya Rashed Al Khalifa to adopt the resolution by an oral vote , the room filled with hundreds of diplomats and UN staff clapping loudly .
#Text=A formal vote was not conducted as the decision was unanimous .
#Text=She banged her gavel after the vote and said , " It is so decided .

#Text= I will work diligently to materialise our responsibility to protect the most vulnerable members of humanity and for the peaceful resolution of threats to international security and regional stability , " Mr. Ban told the Assembly .

_	_	_	_

#Text=Mr. Ban , the first Asian Secretary General since U Thant from Burma , said he was committed to meeting U.N. Millennium Development Goals , expanding peace operations and dealing with threats posed by terrorism and weapons of mass destruction , HIV/AIDS and other pandemics , environmental degradation and protecting human rights .

#Text=He added that he wished Ban strength and courage as he prepared to take over the job and to  have fun along the way .

_	_	_	_

#Text= We believe he is the right person to lead the United Nations at this decisive moment in its history , particularly as the UN struggles to fulfill the terms of the reform agenda that world leaders agreed to last fall , " U.S. Ambassador John R. Bolton told the assembly .

column1: #Text=Israeli Ambassador Danny Gillerman said that it was good for Israel 's standing in the organization .

#Text=" If the secretary general is serious and fair and appoints underlings who are serious and fair , and the UN will be serious , clean and organized , this will be good for the Jews , " said Mr. Gillerman .
#Text=Mr Ban will hold the position for five years until the next election in 2011 .
